intro: Cacalia mansoana, commonly known as the Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its blue to purple flowers bloom in the spring, adding a striking visual element to its habitat. Cacalia mansoana is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial to full sunlight.
